intro: Melicope sambiranensis, commonly known as the Sambiranensis melicope, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Its fruit is a small, woody capsule that contains several seeds. Melicope sambiranensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
